etymology.description: 中国 + 结 = Chinese-style decorative knot.
etymology.interpretation: Names the traditional decorative knots associated with Chinese culture, combining the country/culture term with “knot” to signal origin and style.
etymology.simplification: 國→国 reduces the interior components; 結→结 uses the simplified silk radical 纟 to lower stroke count, improving writing efficiency.

examples.chinese: 我喜欢在门口挂中国结(我喜歡在門口掛中國結)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ xǐhuan zài ménkǒu guà Zhōngguó jié.
examples.english: I like to hang a Chinese knot at the doorway.

examples.chinese: 她送我一个红色的中国结(她送我一個紅色的中國結)，祝我好运(祝我好運)。
examples.pinyin: Tā sòng wǒ yí gè hóngsè de Zhōngguó jié, zhù wǒ hǎo yùn.
examples.english: She gave me a red Chinese knot and wished me good luck.

examples.chinese: 春节时(春節時)，家家户户都用中国结装饰房子(家家戶戶都用中國結裝飾房子)。
examples.pinyin: Chūnjié shí, jiājiā hùhù dōu yòng Zhōngguó jié zhuāngshì fángzi.
examples.english: During Spring Festival, every household uses Chinese knots to decorate the house.
